featureSplit.utils

Class FeatureSplit

  • java.lang.Object
    • featureSplit.utils.FeatureSplit

  • public class FeatureSplit
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a feature split: the set of views (feature subsets) of the original dataset that has a unique feature set

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FeatureSplit()

      Compares two feature splits based on the view sets they contain.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getFeatureIndicesForView(int viewNo)
      Returns the feature indices (original indices in the dataset that contains features from all views, see Feature) of the features in the desired view or null if the desired view does not exist

      Returns the number of views in the feature split

      Returns the view that contains the feature defined by the method parameter or null if such a view does not exist

        public void addView(View view)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a view to the feature split
        Parameters:
        view - view to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the view with the same view number already exists in the dataset

      • getNoViews

        public int getNoViews()
        Returns the number of views in the feature split
        Returns:
        number of views

      • addFeatureToView

        public void addFeatureToView(Feature feature,
                    int viewNo)
        Adds a feature to the desired view defined by the view number. If the desired view does not exist, this method will create a new view with the given number and add the feature to the newly created view
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature to be added
        viewNo - the number of the view to add the feature to

      • getView

        public View getView(int viewNo)
        Returns a view with the desired number or null if the view with that number does not exist
        Parameters:
        viewNo - the number of the desired view
        Returns:
        the desired view

      • getView

        public View getView(Feature feature)
        Returns the view that contains the feature defined by the method parameter or null if such a view does not exist
        Parameters:
        feature - the feature to look for
        Returns:
        the view that contains the feature

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Generates a hash code based on the view set of the feature split
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares two feature splits based on the view sets they contain. Two feature splits are equal if their view sets are equal even if their ordering (view indices) is permuted, e.g. split1[1st view: view1, 2nd view: view2], split2[1st view: view2, 2nd view: view1] => splits split1 and split2 are equal
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • getViews

        public java.util.Set<View> getViews()
        Returns the set of views that describe a feature split
        Returns:
        the set of views of the feature split

      • getFeatureIndicesForView

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getFeatureIndicesForView(int viewNo)
        Returns the feature indices (original indices in the dataset that contains features from all views, see Feature) of the features in the desired view or null if the desired view does not exist
        Parameters:
        viewNo - number of the desired view
        Returns:
        the indices of the features from the view
